name: Crash Course
description: Efforts to improve things at the Academy (as well as its reputation) continue, as a new initiative is presented to pair cadets with crews, especially those from other times and universes. But with this initiative comes new risks - and new threats!
rules:
-- In a Voyage Event, you will engage in Voyages with ocassional Voyage Encounters that will test proficiencies of your voyage crew.
-- In this event, Gold and Silver skills for Voyages will be SCI and ENG. 
-- Voyage Encounters take place at the following points in time: 1 minute, 5 minutes, 15 minutes, 30 minutes, 45 minutes, 1 hour, 1.5 hours, 2 hours, and every 2 hours after that.
-- Passing a Voyage Encounter without losing any contests raises the multiplier for Victory Points gained in contests. Losing a contest resets this multiplier.
-- Three of the following traits are randomly chosen for each Encounter: Inspiring, Explorer, Scoundrel, Casual, Playful, Hero, Marksman, Investigator. Using crew with matching traits increases their Crit Chance in contests.
-- Using any version of Tilly, Finney, Kleg, or Educators will provide a bonus to antimatter and a permanent multiplier to passively gained Victory Points.
-- Using the Artifact, the U.S.S. Exeter, the NX-Class Ship, or ships with the Explorer trait will provide a bonus to antimatter.
-- Earn Event Victory Points passively by running a voyage, and actively by winning contests during Voyage Encounters. The amount you earn increases with every Voyage Encounter passed. 
-- Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Bonus: Explorer (Ship trait), Tilly, Finney, Kleg, Educator

featured_crew.name: Juliet
featured_crew.flavor: Juliet is a beautiful daughter, she probably looks like her father, Christopher Pike. It's a shame she doesn't exist in real life.

action.name: Dad, You Never Listen To Me

featured_crew.name: Finney
featured_crew.flavor: Finney had been holding a grudge against his more successful friend Kirk for years and struck him when he least expected it.

action.name: You Ruined Me, But You Won't Do It Anymore

featured_crew.name: Kleg
featured_crew.flavor: A Ledosian flight instructor who taught Paris the rules of flying in Ledosian space.

action.name: All My Students Complete The Entire Course

rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

ship.name: The Artifact
ship.flavor: This Borg vessel is severed from the Collective and hosted both research and rehabilitation for xBs. Now active, its queencell, Borg population, and repair systems are engaged.

ship.name: U.S.S. Exeter
ship.flavor: A Constitution-class Starfleet vessel that got abandoned after its crew got infected with an unknown disease.

rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Juliet
rewards.flavor: Juliet is a beautiful daughter, she probably looks like her father, Christopher Pike. It's a shame she doesn't exist in real life.

action.name: Dad, You Never Listen To Me

rewards.name: Kleg
rewards.flavor: A Ledosian flight instructor who taught Paris the rules of flying in Ledosian space.
